description: Over 80% of computers run Microsoft Operating systems. As a result, the Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate is one of the first steps for those seeking to start a technical career. The 70-697 Configuring Windows Devices exam covers topics that are a “must know” for anyone responsible for deploying, maintaining and supporting Windows desktops and other devices in a corporate or enterprise environment. Most people know how to use Windows in a home environment, but there are many features under the hood that are designed for environments with a large quantity of computers. The MCSA dives into those and gives the viewer a whole new toolbox for ensuring their computing environment is functional and stable.
descriptionMD: _This show is still in production.  We are updating the recording to reflect new features and interface.  The previously recorded one will be moved to Legacy when this updated version is complete._Over 80% of computers run Microsoft Operating systems. As a result, the Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate is one of the first steps for those seeking to start a technical career. The 70-697 Configuring Windows Devices exam covers topics that are a “must know” for anyone responsible for deploying, maintaining and supporting Windows desktops and other devices in a corporate or enterprise environment. Most people know how to use Windows in a home environment, but there are many features under the hood that are designed for environments with a large quantity of computers. The MCSA dives into those and gives the viewer a whole new toolbox for ensuring their computing environment is functional and stable.
name: MCSA Windows 10 - 70-697 (UPDATED 2018)
subtitle: Configuring Windows Devices

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike demonstrate using a Microsoft account to synchronize settings across multiple devices. They also look at how to disable this functionality using Group Policy. Then they demonstrate how to assign an Office 365 license to a user.
episodes.title: Support Microsoft Store and Cloud Apps

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike look at installing and managing software using Microsoft Office 365. They explore the Microsoft Store, and discuss the Microsoft Store for Business and for Education. They also look at manually updating Microsoft Store apps.
episodes.title: Support Microsoft Store and Cloud Apps Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike look at sideloading LOB apps using PowerShell and DISM. They demonstrate how to enable sideloading, and then sideload an app for an individual, then all users on a system.
episodes.title: Support Microsoft Store and Cloud Apps Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike look at deploying apps using Microsoft Intune. They sideload a line-of-business app and deep link a Microsoft Store app. Then they use the Company Portal to install the apps.
episodes.title: Support Microsoft Store and Cloud Apps Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike look at supporting authentication and authorization. They discuss the concept of multi-factor authentication. Then they demonstrate working with certificates, installing them and how to add a trusted certificate to the appropriate certificate store in Windows 10.
episodes.title: Support Authentication and Authorization

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue their look at authentication and authorization. They look at biometric options in Windows 10, including using a fingerprint scanner or facial recognition to log in.
episodes.title: Support Authentication and Authorization Pt2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue their look at authentication and authorization. They demonstrate creating and using and virtual smart cards. They also look at configuring Homegroups.
episodes.title: Support Authentication and Authorization Pt3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue their look at authentication and authorization. They demonstrate creating and using and virtual smart cards. They also look at configuring Homegroups, as well as differentiating between workgroup and domain authentication.
episodes.title: Support Authentication and Authorization Pt4

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike finish their discussion about authentication and authorization. They discuss secure channel and credential caching. They look at account policies used to secure user accounts. They also demonstrate using Credential Manager.
episodes.title: Support Authentication and Authorization Pt5

episodes.description: In this episode Cherokee and Mike begin their look at migrating user data. They demonstrate how to begin the process using the User State Migration Tool (USMT). They explore the default configuration files, and demonstrate generating and modifying a custom configuration file.
episodes.title: Migrate and Configure User Data

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike demonstrate using scanstate to collect the user data to be migrated, and several switches that can be used with scanstate to control which profiles are migrated. Then they use loadstate to pull the migrated data to the destination machine.
episodes.title: Migrate and Configure User Data Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike work with profiles in Windows 10. They work with local profiles, discussing the components that make up a profile. Then they look at configuring folder location, and using Group Policy to redirect folders to a network location.
episodes.title: Migrate and Configure User Data Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue to work with profiles. This time they demonstrate how to configure roaming profiles. They modify a user account in Active Directory, and use PowerShell to modify a user account.
episodes.title: Migrate and Configure User Data Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike begin their look at working with Hyper-V in Windows 10. They begin by installing Hyper-V, after discussing the various ways to start the installation. Then they look at the different settings available to configure Hyper-V.
episodes.title: Configure Hyper-V

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike discuss the options available when creating virtual hard drives. They discuss the different formats, VHD and VHDX, as well as the different types, fixed, dynamic and differencing.
episodes.title: Configure Hyper-V Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue working with Hyper-V. They demonstrate creating the different types of virtual hard drives using the GUI and PowerShell.
episodes.title: Configure Hyper-V Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue working with Hyper-V. They demonstrate creating a virtual machine using the new virtual machine wizard in Hyper-V.
episodes.title: Configure Hyper-V Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue working with Hyper-V. They demonstrate creating new virtual machines, this time using fixed drives and differencing drives.
episodes.title: Configure Hyper-V Part 5

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue to work with Hyper-V, focusing on networking. They explain the different types of virtual switches available in Hyper-V, and demonstrate how to create them, and connect virtual machines to them.
episodes.title: Configure Hyper-V Part 6

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike wrap up their look at Hyper-V. They start by looking at integration services, what they are and how to install them. Then they demonstrate working with checkpoints, differentiating between production checkpoints and standard checkpoints.
episodes.title: Configure Hyper-V Part 7

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike work with mobility options in Windows 10. They demonstrate how to configure and use offline files.
episodes.title: Configure Mobility Options

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike work with mobility options in Windows 10. They work with power options, creating power plans on the local machine, and using Group Policy.
episodes.title: Configure Mobility Options Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike work with mobility options in Windows 10. They demonstrate how to configure and use Windows To Go.
episodes.title: Configure Mobility Options Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike work with mobility options in Windows 10. They discuss sync options and the Windows Mobility Center.
episodes.title: Configure Mobility Options Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike begin their conversation about supporting mobile devices. They start by connecting a device to Microsoft Azure. Then they demonstrate working with Microsoft Intune compliance policies.
episodes.title: Support Mobile Devices

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike work with Microsoft Intune configuration policies. Then they demonstrate setting up Work Folders and connecting a corporate device.
episodes.title: Support Mobile Devices Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue to look at Work Folders. They connect a personal laptop to Work Folders. Then they demonstrate configuring offline files.
episodes.title: Support Mobile Devices Part 3

topics.title: Plan and Implement a Microsoft Intune Device Management Solution

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike look at configuring IP settings. They configure an IP address statically and through DHCP. They examine the advanced settings for DNS.
episodes.title: Configure IP Settings

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike look at configuring IP settings. They examine the advanced settings for DNS. They also look at configuring network location.
episodes.title: Configure IP Settings Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike configure network settings. They look at connecting to wireless networks and managing preferred wireless networks. They also discuss location-aware printing, and how Windows 10 implements this feature.
episodes.title: Configure Network Settings

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike begin their discussion on configuring network security. They demonstrate configuring firewall settings using both the Windows Firewall console, and the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security console.
episodes.title: Configure Network Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue their discussion on configuring network security. They demonstrate configuring connection security rules and look at the options available.
episodes.title: Configure Network Security Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue their discussion on configuring network security. They also look at configuring authentication exemptions as well as configuring network discovery.
episodes.title: Configure Network Security Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike configure shared resources. They discuss applying share permissions and how they impact access. Then they configure public folder sharing.
episodes.title: Configure Shared Resources

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue their look at shared resources. They demonstrate both the basic sharing wizard, and the advanced sharing method.
episodes.title: Configure Shared Resources Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue their look at shared resources. They start by creating a share using PowerShell. Then they demonstrate configuring a Homegroup and libraries.
episodes.title: Configure Shared Resources Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue their look at shared resources. They start by configuring shared printers. Then they demonstrate configuring OneDrive.
episodes.title: Configure Shared Resources Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike work with Encrypting File System. They explain how EFS works, and demonstrate encrypting files and folders.
episodes.title: Configure File and Folder Access

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue their look at EFS. They demonstrate how to configure a Data Recovery Agent, and use the recovery agent to recover an encrypted file.
episodes.title: Configure File and Folder Access Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike look at configuring NTFS permissions. They describe the permissions available, and how to assign the permissions to users and groups. They also look at the difference between explicit permissions and inherited permissions.
episodes.title: Configure File and Folder Access Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike demonstrate how to make changes to inherited permissions. They also explore using the effective access tab to verify and troubleshoot NTFS permissions.
episodes.title: Configure File and Folder Access Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike take a look at configuring NTFS disk quotas. Then they demonstrate how to configure file access auditing.
episodes.title: Configure File Access Auditing

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue their look at configuring file access auditing. They complete the configuration process and check the results.
episodes.title: Configure File Access Auditing Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike begin their look at configuring remote connections. They demonstrate configuring a system to accept remote desktop connections and how to make the connection.
episodes.title: Configure Remote Connections

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Mike begin their look at configuring remote connections. They start with remote desktop. They demonstrate configuring a system to accept remote desktop connections and some new features available through RDP. They also take a look at Remote Desktop Connection Manager.
episodes.title: Configure Remote Connections Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Mike begin their look at configuring remote connections. They start with remote desktop. They demonstrate configuring a system to accept remote desktop connections and some new features available through RDP. They also take a look at Remote Desktop Connection Manager.
episodes.title: Configure Remote Connections Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Mike begin their look at configuring remote connections. They start with remote desktop. They demonstrate configuring a system to accept remote desktop connections and some new features available through RDP. They also take a look at Remote Desktop Connection Manager.
episodes.title: Configure Remote Connections Part 4 2018

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Mike continue their discussion on configuring remote connections. They look at the various VPN protocols supported by Windows 10. They demonstrate how to configure a VPN connection to use a specific protocol, and look at the available options.
episodes.title: Configure Remote Access

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Mike finish their look at configuring remote connections. They discuss some of the new VPN features introduced in Windows 10. They also look at BranchCache and DirectAccess.
episodes.title: Configure Remote Access Part 2

episodes.description:
In this episode, Cherokee and Mike configure system recovery. They begin  
by creating a recovery drive. Then they look at how to configure and use system  
restore points.
episodes.title: Configure System Recovery

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike continue their look at configuring system recovery. They look at using PowerShell to work with restore points. Then they explore Windows 10 advanced startup options.
episodes.title: Configure System Recovery Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike wrap up their discussion on configuring
episodes.title: Configure System Recovery Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Mike configure file recovery. They start by configuring file history. They demonstrate enabling file history, using the default settings. Then they look at ways to customize file history.
episodes.title: Configure File Recovery

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Mike configure update settings. They look at how to manually check for updates and how to control when updates are applied. They also look at some advanced update options.
episodes.title: Configure and Manage Updates
